CHAPTER 1-11
ESTABLISHING  PLANNING  &  ZONING  COMMISSION
1-11-1
ESTABLISHING PLANNING & ZONING COMMISSION
A Planning & Zoning Commission is hereby created for the City of Brandon, South
Dakota, with all the powers, authorities, jurisdictions and duties as provided in SDCL 11-
4 and 11- 6, and acts amendatory thereto, relating to City planning and zoning and
comprehensive City planning.
Legislative History:
Authority:
Ordinance #4, 3/14/74.
SDCL Ch. 11-4 & 11-6.
Ordinance #297, 11-6-00
1-11-2
MEMBERSHIP, APPOINTMENTS, TERMS AND QUALIFICATIONS
A.
Membership shall consist of seven persons, six to be appointed by the Mayor of the City of
Brandon, South Dakota, and confirmed by the City Council of said City.  The term of each member
of the Planning & Zoning Commission shall be for three years, with two members appointed each
year.  An appointment to fill a vacancy shall be only for the unexpired portion of the term.  All
members of the said Commission shall reside within the City of Brandon, South Dakota. Each
member shall be entitled to one vote.
B.
The seventh member of the Commission shall be a Brandon City Council person, duly elected to
that position and representing the Brandon City Council, who shall be appointed to the Commission
by the Mayor and approved by the City Council for a one year term.  The Council representative
shall act as the Chairman of the Commission and shall only vote in the event of a tie.

1-11-3
OFFICERS
A.
The Officers of the Planning & Zoning Commission shall consist of a Chairman,
Vice-Chairman, and Secretary.  The Secretary need not be a member of the
Commission.
B.
The Chairman shall preside at all meetings and hearings of the Planning &
Zoning Commission and shall have the duties normally conferred by
parliamentary usage on such officers.
C.
The Vice Chairman shall act for the Chairman in his/her absence. 
D.
The Secretary shall keep the minutes and records of the Commission, and with
the assistance of such staff as is available, shall prepare the agenda of regular
and special meetings under the direction of the Chairman, provide notice of all
meetings to Commission members, arrange proper and legal notice of hearings,
attend to correspondence of the Commission and such other duties as are
normally carried out by a Secretary.

1-11-4
ELECTION OF OFFICERS
A.
An annual organization meeting shall be held at the first regular meeting in the
month of June.
B.
Nominations shall be made from the floor at the annual organization meeting and
election of the officers Vice Chair as specified in Brandon Municipal Ordinance
1-11-3 herein, shall follow immediately thereafter.
C.
A candidate receiving a majority vote from those present of the Planning &
Zoning Commission shall be declared elected, and shall serve for one year or
until his successor shall take office.
D.
Vacancies in office shall be filled immediately by regular election procedure.

1-11-5
MEETINGS
A.
Meetings will be held on the 1st and 3rd Thursday of each month at 6:30 P.M. at
the City Hall of the City of Brandon, South Dakota or at such other locations and
times as determined by the Commission. 
B.
A quorum shall consist of four (4) members of the Commission.  The number of
votes necessary to transact business shall be four (4) a majority of the quorum
present unless specified otherwise.
C.
Special meetings may be called by the Chairman.
D.
All meetings at which official action is taken shall be open to the general public.
E.
Unless otherwise specified, Robert's Rules of Order shall govern the proceedings
at the meetings of this Commission.

1-11-6
ORDER OF BUSINESS
A.
The order of business at regular meetings shall be:
 
1.    
Roll Call
2.
Reading of minutes of previous meeting and action thereon
3.
Communications and bills
4.
Reports of Officers and Committees
5.
Old Business
6.
New Business
7.
Adjournment
A.
The matter before the Commission shall be presented in summary by the
Chairman, and parties in interest shall have the privilege of the floor.
B.
No record or statement shall be recorded or sworn to as evidence for any Court
of law without notice to the parties.
C.
A record shall be kept of those speaking before the Commission at such
hearings.

1-11-7
PUBLIC HEARINGS
A.
In addition to those required by law, the Commission may hold public hearings
when it decides that such hearings will be in the public interest.
B.
Notice of the time and place of such hearing, when on matters of widespread
interest, shall be published in the legal newspaper of the City of Brandon and
shall be published at least five days prior to the hearing.  For matters of limited
territorial interest, notice shall be given in such manner as is deemed appropriate
by the Commission.

1-11-8
WAIVER OF NOTICE
Whenever any notice is required to be given to the members of the Planning & Zoning
Commission under the provisions of the South Dakota Compiled Laws of 1967 and acts
amendatory thereto, a waiver thereof in writing, signed by the person or persons entitled
to such notice, whether before or after the time stated therein, shall be deemed equivalent
to the giving of such notice.

1-11-9
COMPENSATION OF MEMBERS
All members of the Planning and Zoning Commission shall be paid as determined by
Resolution of the Brandon City Council plus such additional cost, fees and per diem as
are from time-to-time incurred.
